summary: I know that you appreciate and support all the artist on this site, but some of tim goodman art is not right. They don't draw...
question: I know that you appreciate and support all the artist on this site, but some of tim goodman art is not right. They don't draw his features properly, i know some people can have trouble doing that, and they do apologise for it. However, i saw some people do a good lucy art and not-so-good tim art. And we all know how black people are represented in anime.
answer: I think artists can choose to draw characters the way they like and imagine regardless of skincolor or other features. Thats what art is all about, creativity.

reblog.comment: I think artists can choose to draw characters the way they like and imagine regardless of skincolor or other features. Thats what art is all about, creativity.

trail.content_raw: I think artists can choose to draw characters the way they like and imagine regardless of skincolor or other features. Thats what art is all about, creativity.
trail.content: I think artists can choose to draw characters the way they like and imagine regardless of skincolor or other features. Thats what art is all about, creativity.

summary: In detective Pikachu. Pikachu can't use his powers during the fight with Charizard because he didn't get enough sleep. And you...
body:
GUYS I JUST REALIZED

In detective Pikachu. Pikachu can’t use his powers during the fight with Charizard because he didn’t get enough sleep. And you know what happens when Pikachu sleep?

Pikachus charge while they sleep

blog.name: quillium

tags: I have a lot more thoughts but I'm lazy but if you wanna talk about the movie I'm up for that
but please don't be mean about it
summary: Okay, just watched Detective Pikachu and some thoughts thoughts. 1. It’s important to note that I did NOT know anything beyond...
body:
Okay, just watched Detective Pikachu and some thoughts thoughts.

1. It’s important to note that I did NOT know anything beyond the basics about Pokemon. I was never involved in anything even vaguely resembling Pokemon growing up and didn’t know anything going in. There’s this idea that people are passing on that Detective Pikachu is a ‘nostalgia thing’ or ‘can’t be enjoyed by non-Pokemon fans’ and I am here to say that is undermining the movie and such a lie, it’s a great movie even if you know nothing about Pokemon.

2. They give up fairly quick and easy information in the beginning, setting up the world so that non-fans won’t be confused while still in a manner that doesn’t annoy people who know everything already because they’ve consumed it all. I know because I went to watch DP with someone who’s been a huge fan for over a decade and we both equally loved it.

3. Really gorgeously shot. The way they handled the setting, lighting–ugh, just everything. Beautiful. The way that they did the lighting, where it was kind of unclear at first (apartment shot with the window light blocking Tim’s face, Lucy with the flashlight in the lab and the light blurring the edges) but grew more clear as the mystery became more clear (clean shots, daytime makes it easier to see everything) was really well done.

4. Lovely characterization. Not perfect, mind you, but Tim’s loner status being established from the beginning (and the way they SHOWED rather than told, continually making it an actual theme of the movie and a place requiring character development that they FOLLOWED THROUGH ON, Tim’s terrible with communication and yet perfectly understands Mr. Mime) and Pikachu’s… yeah, just Pikachu (he calls it “my apartment” which might be foreshadowing but is also just hilarious, “I choose this, I can quit anytime”, the scared way he reacts when the Charizard is given the R serum, ugh, I could go on, super well done). I know there were some complaints about the characters but I adored it and thought they did a superb job here.

5. Okay, yeah, the plot was pretty obvious and the twists were easily foreseen but I’m okay with that. It was a kid’s movie, after all, and while it was campy it was all good fun. Really enjoyable.

6. My only real issue with this movie was the ending where we find out that Pikachu was actually Tim’s dad and Pikachu fused together–I understand why it was done and I get it, but I wish that Tim’s dad had just stayed dead. Pikachu and Tim had a buddy-buddy partner relationship and to have that destroyed and turned into a father-son relationship is a bit disappointing. That being said, it wasn’t a big deal and it was obvious that Tim’s dad was alive and something was up with Pikachu. I would have enjoyed something where Tim’s dad chose a pokemon that had been experimented on as his partner which is why Pikachu could communicate with Tim and Tim’s dad stayed dead but Tim decides to redecorate his apartment and stay there to become a detective but yeah, I get it, and I’m not mad about the ending, I’m alright with it.

7. That scene with the Bulbasaurs is super well loved and I can see why, it was ethereal. HOWEVER, something I also loved, that scene where Tim is walking away from Pikachu (after the coffee conversation) and there’s a taxi nearby and the lighting is kind of–yeah. Gorgeous. The whole movie was gorgeous.

8. The movie hit a lot of good emotional beats (that scene with Tim crying in the apartment at the beginning, when Pikachu walks away saying he only hurts those he cares about, etc.) and I can’t understand why fans would downgrade it by calling it “mediocre”.

9. The scene with Mr. Mime was golden and you cannot convince me otherwise.

10. Loved Lucy, really happy they prioritized platonic and familial relationships in this film and Lucy having such an extra yet campy personality was the cherry on top. The way she dramatically leans in her intro and is all pushy and overcompensates but is an unpaid intern, just–I love Lucy.
body_abstract:
Okay, just watched Detective Pikachu and some thoughts thoughts.

1. It’s important to note that I did NOT know anything beyond the basics about Pokemon. I was never involved in anything even vaguely resembling Pokemon growing up and didn’t know anything going in. There’s this idea that people are passing on that Detective Pikachu is a ‘nostalgia thing’ or ‘can’t be enjoyed by non-Pokemon fans’ and I am here to say that is undermining the movie and such a lie, it’s a great movie even if you know nothing about Pokemon.

1. It’s important to note that I did NOT know anything beyond the basics about Pokemon. I was never involved in anything even vaguely resembling Pokemon growing up and didn’t know anything going in. The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it...
caption:
POKEDEX #252   |   TREECKO, THE WOOD GECKO POKEMON 

The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls 
and ceilings. This Pokemon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
